intro: Fimbristylis dasyphylla, commonly known as the hairy flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as swamps, marshes, and along waterways. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Fimbristylis dasyphylla is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline or brackish conditions.
